Detailed Description

A header file for additional functionality of the U(S)ART library.

Requires the avr/pgmspace.h header (from the avr-libc).

Function Documentation

void UART_gets (  uint8_t  device,
uint8_t  str[],
uint8_t  maxlen
) 
 

Receives maxlen characters from UART.

This function places maxlen incoming bytes into str array.
It waits for data by active polling (no sleep - just simple infinite while loop).
Function does not perform any error checking.

Parameters:
device The number of the uart device (starts with 0) to read from.
str Space where incoming datai will be placed.
maxlen Exactly this number of bytes will be placed into str.

void UART_gets_delim (  uint8_t  device,
uint8_t  str[],
uint8_t  delim,
uint8_t  maxlen
) 
 

Receives characters from the UART until specified delimiter is encounterd or maxlen characters is received.

This function places up to maxlen received bytes into the str array. If during data receiving delim charcter is encountered then function stop acquiring data and returns.
It waits for data by active polling (no sleep - just simple infinite while loop).
Function does not perform any error checking.

Parameters:
device The number of the uart device (starts with 0) to read from.
str Space where will be placed incoming data.
delim Character with this value will stop data receiving.
maxlen Up to this number of bytes will be placed into str.
Returns:
uint8_t Number of received characters (including delimiter).

void UART_puts (  uint8_t  device,
const uint8_t  str[]
) 
 

Sends C type string to UART.

This function sends characters from str throught U(S)ART by placing them into outgoing buffer until NULL byte is encountered.
If there is no space in the TX buffer then it waits (no sleep - just simple infinite while loop).
Function does not perform any error checking.

Parameters:
device The number of the uart device (starts with 0) to write to.
str C string which will be transmitted (must be NULL terminated).

void UART_puts_P (  uint8_t  device,
PGM_P  str
) 
 

Transmits C type string from FLASH to UART.

This function sends characters from str through U(S)ART by placing them into outgoing buffer until NULL byte is encoountered. A str is a pointer to data into FLASH memory.
It waits for space in TX buffer (no sleep - just simple infinite while loop).
Function does not perform any error checking.

Parameters:
device The number of the uart device (starts with 0) to write to.
str C string placed in FLASH memory which will be transmitted (must be NULL terminated).

void UART_sleep_RX (  uint8_t  device  ) 
 

Functions blocks execution (CPU sleep) until there is received at least one byte.

You have to enable sleep mode before e.g.: set_sleep_mode(SLEEP_MODE_IDLE);

Parameters:
device The number of the uart device (starts with 0) to wait receiving.

void UART_sleep_TX_empty (  uint8_t  device  ) 
 

Functions blocks execution (CPU sleep) until the output buffer become empty.

You have to enable sleep mode before e.g.: set_sleep_mode(SLEEP_MODE_IDLE);

Parameters:
device The number of the uart device (starts with 0) to wait for empty TX queue.

void UART_wait_RX (  uint8_t  device  ) 
 

Functions blocks execution (waits) until the input buffer is filled with at least one byte.

Parameters:
device The number of the uart device (starts with 0) to wait receiving.

void UART_wait_TX_empty (  uint8_t  device  ) 
 

Functions blocks execution (waits) until the output buffer become empty.

Parameters:
device The number of the uart device (starts with 0) to wait for empty TX queue.
